page.title: 06EDUCATION IN ASSYNT
page.content: In Assynt, local Churches operated schools until our present school opened in 1872 with 32 pupils. Our school used to be a Junior Secondary School until 1974. Pupils of Secondary age now have the choice to travel 35 miles to Ullapool daily or to board weekly at Golspie, 65 miles away! The largest attendence at our school was recorded in 1919 when 90 pupils attended. Today Lochinver has 52 pupils with 3 full-time teachers and 4 visiting teachers. All the Children take school dinners! The school roll is critical today, because of educational cut-backs. The school will be threatened with the loss of a full-time teacher if numbers fall! The school is uniquely situated on a peninsula in the middle of the Culag Loch! A traditional stone building, it is the only school in our area.
